description: Comprehensive Geometry concepts covering shapes, measurements, and spatial relationships

definition.text: An angle is formed when two rays share a common endpoint called the vertex. Angles are measured in degrees (°) or radians. A full rotation is 360° or 2π radians.

keyFormulas.name: Angle Classifications
keyFormulas.formula:
Acute: 0° < θ < 90°
Right: θ = 90°
Obtuse: 90° < θ < 180°
Straight: θ = 180°

keyFormulas.name: Degree-Radian Conversion
keyFormulas.meaning: Convert between units of angle measure

examples.question: Find the complement of 35°
Convert 60° to radians

realWorldApplications.title: Architecture
realWorldApplications.description: Roof pitch, door frames, and structural supports all involve angle calculations

realWorldApplications.title: Navigation
realWorldApplications.description: Direction and bearing are measured in degrees

definition.text: A triangle is a polygon with three sides, three vertices, and three angles. The sum of interior angles in any triangle is always 180°. Triangles are classified by their sides (equilateral, isosceles, scalene) or angles (acute, right, obtuse).

keyFormulas.name: Area Formula
keyFormulas.meaning: Half of base times perpendicular height

keyFormulas.name: Pythagorean Theorem
keyFormulas.meaning: For right triangles: sum of squared legs equals squared hypotenuse

keyFormulas.name: Triangle Inequality
keyFormulas.formula: a + b > c for all sides
keyFormulas.meaning: Sum of any two sides must exceed the third

examples.question: Find the third angle of a triangle if two angles are 45° and 70°
Find the hypotenuse of a right triangle with legs 3 and 4
Find the area of a triangle with sides 5, 6, and 7
examples.verification: Using base-height method gives same result

proof: Consider a right triangle with legs a and b, hypotenuse c
Construct a square with side (a + b)
Inside, place 4 copies of the triangle, forming a tilted square in the center
Area of large square = (a + b)²
Area also = 4 × (½ab) + c² = 2ab + c²
Setting equal: (a + b)² = 2ab + c²
Expanding: a² + 2ab + b² = 2ab + c²
Simplifying: a² + b² = c² □

realWorldApplications.title: Construction
realWorldApplications.description: Using 3-4-5 triangles to ensure right angles

definition.text: A circle is the set of all points in a plane that are equidistant from a fixed point called the center. The distance from the center to any point on the circle is the radius.

keyFormulas.name: Arc Length
keyFormulas.meaning: Length of arc for central angle θ

keyFormulas.name: Circle Equation (Standard Form)
keyFormulas.meaning: Circle centered at (h, k) with radius r

examples.question: Find the circumference and area of a circle with radius 7 cm
Find the arc length of a 60° arc in a circle with radius 6 cm

steps.action: Apply arc length formula: s = rθ

examples.verification: 60° is 1/6 of full circle; C = 12π, so arc = 12π/6 = 2π ✓

examples.question: Write the equation of a circle with center (3, -2) and radius 5

steps.action: Use standard form: (x - h)² + (y - k)² = r²

examples.verification: Point (3, 3) is 5 units from (3, -2) and satisfies equation ✓

proof: Divide circle into n equal sectors
Arrange sectors alternating up and down to form a parallelogram-like shape
As n → ∞, shape approaches a rectangle
Height of rectangle = radius r
Width of rectangle = half circumference = πr
Area = height × width = r × πr = πr² □

realWorldApplications.title: Wheels and Gears
realWorldApplications.description: Calculating rotation distances and gear ratios

realWorldApplications.title: Pizza Pricing
realWorldApplications.description: Area determines value - doubling diameter quadruples area

definition.text: Coordinate geometry (analytic geometry) studies geometry using a coordinate system. Points are represented as ordered pairs (x, y) on the Cartesian plane, allowing algebraic methods to solve geometric problems.

keyFormulas.name: Midpoint Formula
keyFormulas.meaning: Point exactly halfway between two points

keyFormulas.name: Slope Formula
keyFormulas.meaning: Rise over run; rate of change

keyFormulas.name: Perpendicular Lines
keyFormulas.meaning: Perpendicular lines have negative reciprocal slopes

keyFormulas.name: Section Formula
keyFormulas.meaning: Point dividing segment in ratio m:n

examples.question: Find the distance between A(1, 2) and B(4, 6)
Find the midpoint of segment from (2, 5) to (8, 11)
examples.verification: Distance from (2,5) to (5,8) equals distance from (5,8) to (8,11) ✓

examples.question: Find the slope of a line perpendicular to y = 3x + 2

steps.explanation: Coefficient of x in slope-intercept form

definition.text: Solid geometry studies three-dimensional figures including prisms, cylinders, pyramids, cones, and spheres. Key measurements include volume (space occupied) and surface area (total area of all faces).

keyFormulas.name: Cube
keyFormulas.meaning: Volume and surface area of cube with side s

keyFormulas.name: Rectangular Prism
keyFormulas.meaning: For box with length l, width w, height h

keyFormulas.name: Cylinder
keyFormulas.latex: V = \pi r^2 h, \quad SA = 2\pi r^2 + 2\pi rh
keyFormulas.meaning: Volume and surface area with radius r, height h

keyFormulas.name: Cone
keyFormulas.latex: V = \frac{1}{3}\pi r^2 h, \quad SA = \pi r^2 + \pi rl
keyFormulas.meaning: Where l is slant height: l = √(r² + h²)

keyFormulas.name: Sphere
keyFormulas.meaning: Volume and surface area of sphere with radius r

keyFormulas.name: Pyramid
keyFormulas.meaning: Where B is base area and h is perpendicular height

examples.question: Find the volume and surface area of a cube with side 4 cm
examples.verification: Cube has 6 equal faces, each 16 cm² ✓

examples.question: Find the volume of a sphere with radius 3 cm
Find the volume of a cone with radius 5 cm and height 12 cm
examples.verification: Cone is 1/3 the volume of a cylinder with same base and height ✓

realWorldApplications.title: Tank Capacity
realWorldApplications.description: Calculating storage capacity for cylindrical tanks

realWorldApplications.title: Ice Cream Cones
realWorldApplications.description: Volume of ice cream that fits in a cone

realWorldApplications.title: Ball Sports
realWorldApplications.description: Size specifications for basketballs, soccer balls

definition.text: A quadrilateral is a polygon with four sides and four vertices. The sum of interior angles is always 360°. Types include parallelograms, rectangles, rhombi, squares, trapezoids, and kites, each with unique properties.

keyFormulas.name: Trapezoid Area
keyFormulas.meaning: Average of parallel bases times height

examples.question: Find the area of a parallelogram with base 8 cm and height 5 cm
examples.verification: Note: slant height would give wrong answer

examples.question: Find the area of a trapezoid with parallel bases 6 cm and 10 cm, and height 4 cm
In a rectangle, length = 12 and width = 5. Find the diagonal.

definition.text: A transformation is a function that moves or changes a geometric figure. The four main types are translations (slides), reflections (flips), rotations (turns), and dilations (resizing). Isometries preserve size and shape.

keyFormulas.name: Translation
keyFormulas.meaning: Move right a units and up b units

keyFormulas.name: Dilation from origin
keyFormulas.meaning: Scale by factor k (k>1 enlarges, 0<k<1 shrinks)

examples.question: Translate point (3, 5) by vector ⟨-2, 4⟩
Reflect point (-2, 5) over the x-axis

steps.explanation: x stays same, y changes sign

examples.question: Rotate point (2, 3) 90° counterclockwise about the origin
examples.verification: Distance from origin unchanged: √13 for both

examples.question: Dilate point (4, -2) by factor 3 from the origin

definition.text: Perimeter is the total distance around a shape (sum of all sides). Area is the amount of surface a shape covers, measured in square units. These fundamental measurements are essential for understanding 2D shapes.

keyFormulas.name: Triangle
keyFormulas.formula: P = a + b + c, A = ½bh

examples.question: Find the perimeter and area of a rectangle 8 cm by 5 cm
examples.verification: Perimeter in cm, area in cm²

examples.question: A square has perimeter 36 cm. Find its area.
Find the area of a circle with diameter 10 m

definition.text: Volume measures the space inside a 3D object, measured in cubic units. Surface area is the total area of all surfaces of a 3D object, measured in square units. These measurements are essential for understanding 3D shapes.

keyFormulas.name: Rectangular Prism
keyFormulas.meaning: l = length, w = width, h = height

keyFormulas.name: Cylinder
keyFormulas.latex: V = \pi r^2 h, \quad SA = 2\pi r^2 + 2\pi rh

keyFormulas.name: Cone
keyFormulas.latex: V = \frac{1}{3}\pi r^2 h, \quad SA = \pi r^2 + \pi r l
keyFormulas.meaning: l = slant height, one base + lateral

examples.question: Find the volume and surface area of a cube with side 4 cm
examples.verification: Volume in cm³, surface area in cm²

examples.question: A cylinder has radius 3 cm and height 10 cm. Find its volume.
Find the surface area of a sphere with radius 6 cm
examples.verification: Surface area is exactly 4 times area of a great circle

realWorldApplications.title: Medicine
realWorldApplications.description: Drug dosage based on body surface area

definition.text: In a right triangle, the square of the hypotenuse equals the sum of squares of the other two sides. This fundamental theorem has hundreds of proofs and countless applications. The converse is also true: if a² + b² = c², the triangle is right.

keyFormulas.name: Common Pythagorean Triples
keyFormulas.meaning: Integer solutions to a² + b² = c²

examples.question: A ladder 13 feet long leans against a wall. The base is 5 feet from the wall. How high up the wall does it reach?

steps.explanation: The ladder forms a right triangle

examples.finalAnswer: The ladder reaches 12 feet up the wall

examples.question: Find the distance between points (2, 3) and (7, 15)
Is a triangle with sides 6, 8, 10 a right triangle?
examples.finalAnswer: Yes, it's a right triangle (it's a multiple of 3-4-5)

proof: Draw a square with side (a + b)
Inside, place 4 copies of the right triangle (sides a, b, c)
The triangles surround a tilted square with side c
Total area = (a+b)² = 4(½ab) + c²
Simplify: a² + 2ab + b² = 2ab + c²
Therefore: a² + b² = c² □

definition.text: Parallel lines never intersect and are equidistant. Perpendicular lines intersect at 90°. When a transversal crosses parallel lines, it creates special angle pairs with specific relationships.

keyFormulas.name: Corresponding Angles
keyFormulas.formula: Corresponding angles are equal when lines are parallel

keyFormulas.name: Alternate Interior Angles
keyFormulas.formula: Alternate interior angles are equal when parallel

keyFormulas.name: Co-Interior Angles
keyFormulas.formula: Co-interior angles sum to 180° when parallel

keyFormulas.name: Slope Relationships
keyFormulas.formula: Parallel: m₁ = m₂, Perpendicular: m₁ × m₂ = -1

examples.question: Lines l and m are parallel. If angle 1 = 65°, find angles 2, 3, 4 where 2 is corresponding, 3 is alternate interior, 4 is co-interior.
examples.verification: All angle relationships confirmed by parallel lines

definition.text: Similar triangles have the same shape but different sizes. Their corresponding angles are equal and corresponding sides are proportional. Similar triangles are used extensively in indirect measurement and scale drawings.

keyFormulas.name: AA Similarity
keyFormulas.formula: If two angles are equal, triangles are similar
keyFormulas.latex: \angle A = \angle D, \angle B = \angle E \Rightarrow \triangle ABC \sim \triangle DEF
keyFormulas.meaning: Two angles is enough (third is determined)

keyFormulas.name: Area Ratio
keyFormulas.meaning: Area scales with square of lengths

examples.question: A 6-foot person casts a 4-foot shadow. A tree casts a 20-foot shadow at the same time. How tall is the tree?

definition.text: A polygon is a closed figure with straight sides. Regular polygons have all sides and angles equal. Understanding polygon properties helps with area calculations and tessellations.

keyFormulas.name: Number of Diagonals
keyFormulas.meaning: Each vertex connects to n-3 others

examples.question: Find the sum of interior angles of a hexagon (6 sides)
examples.verification: A hexagon can be divided into 4 triangles

examples.question: Each interior angle of a regular polygon is 144°. How many sides?

definition.text: Geometric proofs use logical reasoning to establish truth of geometric statements. Two-column proofs list statements with reasons. Proofs develop critical thinking and understanding of why mathematical facts are true.

keyFormulas.name: Exterior Angle Theorem
keyFormulas.formula: Exterior angle = sum of remote interior angles

keyFormulas.name: Isosceles Triangle Theorem
keyFormulas.formula: If two sides equal, base angles are equal

examples.question: Prove: Vertical angles are equal

steps.action: Given: Two intersecting lines form angles 1, 2, 3, 4
steps.result: ∠1 and ∠3 are vertical, ∠2 and ∠4 are vertical

examples.verification: This is a fundamental theorem used in many proofs

definition.text: Circle theorems describe relationships between angles, chords, tangents, and secants in circles. These theorems are fundamental to geometry proofs and have applications in engineering and design.

keyFormulas.name: Tangent-Radius
keyFormulas.formula: Tangent ⊥ Radius at point of tangency

examples.question: A central angle is 80°. What is the inscribed angle subtending the same arc?
Two chords intersect inside a circle. If segments are 4, 6, 3, find x.

definition.text: A vector has both magnitude (length) and direction. Vectors can be added, subtracted, and multiplied by scalars. They're represented as arrows or as ordered pairs/triples of numbers.

keyFormulas.name: Vector Notation
keyFormulas.formula: v⃗ = ⟨a, b⟩ or v⃗ = ai⃗ + bj⃗

examples.question: Find the magnitude of v⃗ = ⟨3, 4⟩
Add vectors u⃗ = ⟨2, 5⟩ and v⃗ = ⟨-1, 3⟩
Find unit vector in direction of ⟨6, 8⟩

definition.text: The distance formula calculates the length between two points. The midpoint formula finds the point exactly halfway between two points. Both are derived from the Pythagorean theorem.

examples.question: Find distance between (1, 2) and (4, 6)
Find midpoint of segment from (-2, 3) to (6, 7)
examples.verification: M is equidistant from both endpoints

definition.text: Special right triangles have angle measures that produce exact side length ratios. The 45-45-90 (isosceles right) and 30-60-90 triangles are essential for trigonometry and geometry problems.

examples.question: In a 45-45-90 triangle, one leg is 7. Find the hypotenuse.
In a 30-60-90 triangle, the hypotenuse is 10. Find both legs.

steps.explanation: Short leg is half the hypotenuse
